titles.title: Buddy Complex
バディ・コンプレックス
Buddy Complex
버디 컴플렉스
BUDDY COMPLEX

relatedanime.anime: Buddy Complex: Kanketsuhen - Ano Sora ni Kaeru Mirai de

recommendations.recommendation: One of my favorite anime in this year. Cool mecha with trans ability that makes you want to watch it to the end of series. Once you see it, u can`t turn back until it finished. Story is quite good, but lacks of MC ability on control his mecha itself is the backward, but the rest is no problem.
If you are fun of Sunrise and love gundams it`s anime for you a lot of fun but 1st season for me was a little bit too short - everything was nicely done and the ending is great!

Although it doesn’t seem at first, the story is falling in place just the right way. In this anime, time-travel somehow makes sense. Also the fighting scenes and war tactics are totally believable. There are definitely better mecha-anime out there, but this one has something more than giant robots. If you are able to look past some classic flaws of anime like the need to tell „hundred“ character background stories in the shortest time humanly possible, then what you get is one of this year’s top10 anime. Rather than preparing for the second season, it would be better to stretch the first one up to 22 episodes and get more substance and maybe some twist into the story.

Great anime, 1 ep starts like normal HS series, after that boom ! That fight, plot and characters!! Watched it in one blow, last series that i watched all day was Full Metal Alchemist Brotherhood :) So yes, i long wated for similar anime. Must see 9/10
One of 2014`s bests so far, story is nicely paced, makes you want to see next episode right away, good mecha show!

It was fun, interesting. The ending felt a bit rushed (rushed like they realized they don`t have money for more episodes, and desperately wanted everything to fall in place and make sense). Yet they have a really bad and unnecessary cliffhanger at the very end.

anime.description: On the first day back after summer break, high-school student Aoba is attacked by a giant robot that appears out of the sky. As he`s pursued through the city, his classmate Hina appears in a robot of her own. She rescues him, and tells him cryptically that "Dio is waiting for you", before she disappears. This begins Aoba`s new life as the pilot of the Free Treaty Alliance against the Great Zogiria Republic. Source: ANN Note: The first episode premiered at a special event held on 29.12.2013. The regular TV broadcast started on 06.01.2014.

externalentity.identifier: バディ・コンプレックス

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: person from the past
tag.description: Possibly via stasis or cryogenic chamber, a person from the past will reawaken into a future present.

tag.name: large-scale war
tag.description: When the whole world, or, at least, a big part of it, partakes in the hell that is war.

tag.name: post-credits scene
tag.description: A little bit of the story is found after the credit titles. A little bonus for those patient enough! This applies regardless of if the credits play over an ED sequence, or over the "regular episode" that continues to air into the credits. A sequence at the end of an episode, showing what will happen in the next episode, is NOT a post-credits scene; that is a preview.

tag.name: time loop
tag.description: A time loop is a common plot device in science fiction (especially in universes where time travel is commonplace). Events in the story repeat themselves a number of times with or without some variation with each pass. Most characters either do not realise this is occurring or are attempting to break the cycle in some way. One well-known example of this is in the 1993 film Groundhog Day, in which the main character is the only one aware of the time loop, although time loops had appeared in many fictional works prior to that. Stories with time loops commonly center on correcting past mistakes or on getting a character to recognise some key truth; escape from the loop may then follow.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Anessa Rossetti
character.description: Age: 16 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Corporal/Operator She`s the operator in charge of controlling Cygnus` Valianecer. Unlike her friend Mayuka, she`s full of energy. Source: ANN

character.name: Alfried Gallant
character.description: Age: 27 Affiliation: Republic of Great Zogilia Rank: Lt. Colonel Pilot of Alsiel. He posses great skill in strategic commands in addition to his clever Valiancer piloting skills. Source: ANN

character.name: Elvira Hill
character.description: Age: 28 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Special Officer She`s in charge of controlling and maintaining the new tactical systems. She`s an extremely skilled researcher, and her personality is bright and active. Source: ANN

character.name: Tarjim Vasily
character.description: Age: 19 Affiliation: Republic of Great Zogilia Rank: 2nd Lieutenant Pilot of Ogre. He`s aggressive, headstrong, and reckless. His strength in combat is great, but his personality is his true fault. Source: ANN

character.name: Bizon Gerafil
character.description: Age: 20 Affiliation: Republic of Great Zogilia Rank: 1st Lieutenant Pilot of Nebiros. An honest soldier born to a prominent family. He`s well trusted by Alfried and often given charge of the front lines. Source: ANN

character.name: Margaret O`Keefe
character.description: Age: 28 Affiliation: Republic of Great Zogilia Rank: Special Officer She`s been dispatched by Zogilia`s Administration Bureau to supervise Alfried`s squad. She often considers her reputation and status above all else. Source: ANN

character.name: Jarl Duran
character.description: Age: 27 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: 1st Lieutenant Pilot of Beryl Assault. Though often sarcastic, he sometimes shows great care for his comrades as well. Source: ANN

character.name: Lasha Hakkarainen
character.description: Age: 18 Affiliation: Republic of Great Zogilia Rank: 2nd Lieutenant Pilot of Krishna. He`s a gentle, tender hearted young man, but he faces his enemies bravely in battle. Source: ANN

character.name: Lee Conrad
character.description: Age: 28 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Captain Pilot of Beryl Commander. He acts as the commander of Cygnus` valiancer squad. He`s friendly and caring, so he`s a bit of an older brother to those aboard Cygnus. Source: ANN

character.name: Lene Kleinbeck
character.description: Age: 27 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Major She act`s as vice captain to Cygnus. She`s an excellent battlefield commander, and Captain Kuramitsu places a lot of trust in her. Source: ANN

character.name: Kuramitsu Gengo
character.description: Age: 38 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Colonel He serves as the captain of the new warship Cygnus. He often seems unreliable and doesn`t stand out much, but he gives price orders based on sharp judgment when it counts. Source: ANN

character.name: Nasu Mayuka
character.description: Age: 16 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: Corporal, Special Officer Aide She serves as Special Officer Elvira`s aide, but practical matters are left in her care. She`s honest and straightforward, but a bit shy. Source: ANN

character.name: Yumihara Hina
character.description: Age: 16 Affiliation: Seiou High School Grade: 10th Aoba`s classmate. She ends up next to him in class following seat changes after the break. Source: ANN

character.name: Watase Aoba
character.description: Age: 16 Affiliation: Seiou High School Grade: 10th A bright, considerate young man. He excels at athletics, especially basketball. Source: ANN

character.name: Junyou Dio Weinberg
character.description: Age: 16 Affiliation: Confederate Treaty of Liberty Rank: 2nd Lieutenant He`s a young ace pilot who commands one of the newest units, Bradyon. He`s calm and stoic, but he has a strong sense of justice in his heart. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-110 Kugel
character.description: Zogilia`s mass-produced Valiancer. This model was designed to surpass the Confederation Army`s Beryl. Preparations for mass-production have recently been completed, and it`s being deployed as the main unit of Zogilia`s forces on the front lines. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-126 Fortuna
character.description: A model specialized in close combat that comes with two swords at it its hips as standard equipment. It`s output is greatly increased in order to allow it to close in with other high-speed Valiancers. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-125 Ogre
character.description: A model developed with a focus on combating other airships. It`s equipped with both heavy firepower and heavy armor. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-122 Krishna
character.description: With an increased output and a lighter frame, this model is specialized in maneuverability. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-121 Nebiros
character.description: A model recognized for its focus on being well-rounded and capable of adapting to the needs of various missions. By equipping a missile launcher in its arm, it can make up for the firepower it lacks when compared to the Kugel. Source: ANN

character.name: ZEH-N-131 Alsiel
character.description: Zogilia`s latest model. By increasing the size and output of the unit`s backpack, it shows a great improvement in mobility and maneuverability over other recent models. Source: ANN

character.name: Cygnus
character.description: Confederate Treaty of Liberty`s newest warship. It`s also the mother ship for Luxon and Bradyon. Even in the Confederation Army, known for implementing the latest in technology, the Cygnus is a flying warship boasting high mobility and combat prowess. Source: ANN

character.name: AG-6C Beryl Commander
character.description: A machine that retains the total balance of the Beryl unit while improving upon its base features to display great overall combat prowess. Called Beryl-C for short. Source: ANN

character.name: AG-6A Beryl Assault
character.description: A variation on the mass-produced Beryl designed to combat the maneuverability of the Zogilian army`s Kugel unit. Called Beryl-A for short. Source: ANN

character.name: AG-6 Beryl
character.description: Mass-produced Confederate Valiancer. It`s a well-balanced machine and has served as the main unit of the Confederation Army for many years. Source: ANN

character.name: XV-7002 Bradyon
character.description: A prototype developed under top secrecy by the Confederation Army. Source: ANN

character.name: XV-7001 Luxon
character.description: A prototype developed under top secrecy by the Confederation Army. Source: ANN

episode.title: 出会い
Encounter
Encuentro
Deai
episode.summary: Aoba Watase is a normal first year high school student coming back to school after summer break when a mysterious robot comes after him. He has never seen it before, but its pilot seems to know him and wants him dead. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決断の時
The Time for Resolve
Ketsudan no Toki
episode.summary: Aoba faces the consequences of his rash actions during combat when he saw Hina. And later, the Cygnus lands at Narashino and Aoba gets a chance to explore his hometown to see what has become of it in the last 70 years. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再会
Meeting Again
Saikai
episode.summary: As Aoba tries to come to grips with this new world that he`s found himself in, the ship he is on comes under attack again. And during this engagement, he unexpectedly comes across someone he knows. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナイスカップリング
Nice Coupling
Nice Coupling
episode.summary: One minute, Hina is disappearing, telling Aoba that Dio is waiting for him. In the next minute, Aoba finds himself in a strange cockpit alone, thrust into the middle of a furious firefight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嵐の夜
Stormy Night
Arashi no Yoru
episode.summary: Aoba finally gets some time to talk to Hina, but as they try to survive the night on the island they crash-landed on, he has a frustrating time trying to get through to her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バディ
Buddy
Buddy
episode.summary: As the Cygnus makes its way to the Hawaii Base, Zogilia`s Protection Division catches up with them. And the three Coupler pilots must decide who will pair up with whom. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もう一人のカップラー
The Other Coupler
Mou Hitori no Coupler
episode.summary: After being mobilized, the Cygnus and the Coupling Valiancers are no longer a secret. In order to defend their existence against outraged politicians, a film crew arrives to make a promotional video to rally popular support. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 傷跡
Scars
Kizuato
episode.summary: Aoba finds out more about Dio and his family. And later, Cygnus unexpectedly finds itself being mobilized against an invading Zogilian force. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりの絆
The Bond Between Them
Futari no Kizuna
episode.summary: The crew of the Cygnus work through the fallout of losing the Luxon and the Bradyon, and of the flawed Coupling that Aoba and Dio conducted using the old Coupling Valiancers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真実
The Truth
Shinjitsu
episode.summary: The Zogilians infiltrate the Hawaii Base. While the crew of the Cygnus work to thwart them, Hina`s father reveals a startling truth to her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 父と子
Father and Child
Chichi to Ko
episode.summary: Aoba, Dio, and Mayuka get to go on shore leave in Hawaii. And in the meantime, the Zogilian contingent plan their next operation to get their hands on the Confederation`s Coupling Valiancers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カップリングシステム
The Coupling System
Coupling System
episode.summary: Discouraged by his encounter with Hina, Aoba mopes around, but Dio finds his sniveling, defeatist attitude unacceptable, especially once they come under attack yet again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アクセプション
Acception
Acception
episode.summary: With over half their fleet gone and up against enemy Coupling Valiancers, the Cygnus is tasked with taking down the Gorgon, Zogilia`s weapon of mass destruction. Source: crunchyroll
